Description: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO PURCHASE LOCAL FOOD TARGETING PURCHASES FROM SMALL BUSINESSES AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS AND RANCHERS, FOR DISTRIBUTION TO SCHOOLS. THE MAINE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION WILL BUILD UPON OUR CURRENT SYSTEMS TO INCREASE BOTH THE NUMBER OF FARMS USED TO SUPPLY SCHOOLS AND THE VOLUME OF LOCAL MAINE FOODS PROCURED BY SCHOOLS ACROSS THE STATE. THE PARTNERSHIP WILL FOCUS ON ELEVATING MAINE’S SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS AND SMALL BUSINESSES TO MAINE SCHOOLS, WHILE BUILDING BUSINESS RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN SCHOOLS AND FARMERS, TO BRING LOCALLY SOURCED FOODS TO THE STUDENTS OF MAINE. THIS GRANT PROVIDES A STRONG FOUNDATION FOR SUSTAINED USE LONG AFTER THE LIFE OF THE LOCAL FOOD FOR SCHOOLS GRANT WHILE SIMULTANEOUSLY STRENGTHENING THE LOCAL AND REGIONAL FOOD SYSTEMS WITHIN MAINE. SCHOOLS WILL BE REQUIRED TO OPT INTO THE PROGRAM AT THE BEGINNING OF THE SCHOOL YEAR. MAINE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION'S CHILD NUTRITION TEAM WILL ALLOCATE THE FUNDS TO SCHOOLS USING STUDENT ENROLLMENT DATA. THIS WILL ENSURE EQUITABLE DISTRIBUTION OF FUNDS TO SCHOOLS AND WILL ALSO DISTRIBUTE FUNDS THROUGHOUT MAINE’S SIXTEEN (16) COUNTIES. MAINE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION'S CHILD NUTRITION TEAM WILL USE OUR CURRENT REIMBURSEMENT SYSTEM TO PROVIDE REIMBURSEMENT TO SCHOOLS. QUARTERLY PERFORMANCE REPORT S WILL BE SUBMITTED TO CAPTURE THE NUMBER OF PRODUCERS, SMALL BUSINESSES AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS AND PRODUCERS, DOLLAR VALUE OF PURCHASES, AND TYPE OF FOOD PURCHASED. ANNUAL REPORTS WILL PROVIDE PERCENTAGES OF NEW MARKETING OPPORTUNITIES ESTABLISHED BY PURCHASING FROM LOCAL AND REGIONAL FARMERS AND PRODUCERS, SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS AND PRODUCERS, AND SMALL BUSINESSES. MAINE FOOD FOR MAINE SCHOOLS WILL FUND PURCHASES FROM UP TO 111 MAINE FARMS. ALL WILL BE SMALL BUSINESSES AND 26 WILL SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED PRODUCERS. THESE PURCHASES WILL IMPROVE NUTRITION FOR 174,652 MAINE SCHOOL CHILDREN BY PROVIDING $776,210 TO 219 MAINE SCHOOLS. THE SCHOOLS IN THE STATE ALREADY PURCHASE FROM 111 DIFFERENT FARMS. WE EXPECT TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF FARMS WE PURCHASE FROM BY 11 AS WELL AS INCREASING THE AMOUNT OF OVERALL LOCAL FOOD WE PURCHASE.

THERE ARE APPROXIMATELY 1100 SCHOOL DISTRICTS IN ILLINOIS THAT WOULD QUALIFY, AND IT IS ESTIMATED THAT APPROXIMATELY HALF WILL CHOOSE TO PARTICIPATE.

THROUGH THIS RELATIONSHIP, A STRONGER PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE LOCAL PRODUCERS AND LOCAL EDUCATION AGENCIES WILL BENEFIT THE COMMUNITY AS A WHOLE. THIS PROVISION OF SUPPORT IS INTENDED TO FACILITATE THE DEVELOPMENT OF A THRIVING REGIONAL LOCAL FOOD ACTIVITY CENTER, WHEREIN SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED AND SMALL BUSINESS PRODUCERS HAVE EXPANDED OPPORTUNITIES, LOCAL SUPPLIERS AND BUYERS ARE EMPOWERED TO COLLABORATE, AND SUPPLY ALIGNS WITH DEMAND EFFECTIVELY AND EQUITABLY. THIS NEBRASKA DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION LED PROJECT WILL SIMULTANEOUSLY INCREASE LOCAL FOOD PURCHASES BY SCHOOLS AND EXPAND OPPORTUNITIES FOR LOCAL, SMALL BUSINESS, AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED PRODUCERS. ANNUAL REPORTS WILL PROVIDE PERCENTAGES OF NEW MARKETING OPPORTUNITIES ESTABLISHED BY PURCHASING FROM LOCAL AND REGIONAL FARMERS AND PRODUCERS, SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS AND PRODUCERS, AND SMALL BUSINESSES. IN CONJUNCTION WITH FUNDS SCHOOLS WILL ALSO RECEIVE SUPPORT VIA RESOURCES AND EVENTS THAT ASSIST WITH MAKING THE SCHOOL AND PRODUCER CONNECTION AND GROW IN UNDERSTANDING ABOUT SUCCESSFULLY PURCHASING FROM LOCAL SMALL BUSINESS AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED PRODUCERS. FOR THE SCOPE OF THIS FOUNDATIONAL PROJECT, WE ESTIMATE THAT 75 NEBRASKA SMALL BUSINESS FOOD PRODUCERS WILL RECEIVE A DIRECT BENEFIT, WHICH ALIGNS WITH THE PLANS FOR LOCAL FOOD PURCHASE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM, AND THIS INCLUDES EIGHT SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED PRODUCERS (USING THE 11% STATEWIDE RATE). THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO PURCHASE LOCAL FOOD TARGETING PURCHASES FROM SMALL BUSINESSES AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS AND RANCHERS, FOR DISTRIBUTION TO SCHOOLS. TO INCREASE SCHOOL LINKAGES TO AND FOOD PROCUREMENT FROM BOTH LOCALLY SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED AND SMALL BUSINESS PRODUCERS, KANSAS STATE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION WILL ISSUE SUBAWARDS TO ALL NATIONAL SCHOOL LUNCH PROGRAM PARTICIPATING SCHOOL FOOD AUTHORITIES FOR THE PURCHASE OF MINIMALLY PROCESSED AND UNPROCESSED MEATS FROM LOCAL SMALL BUSINESSES/PRODUCERS, THEREBY ENCOURAGING MARKET DIVERSIFICATION. SCHOOL FOOD AUTHORITIES WILL BE ENCOURAGED TO PRIORITIZE PURCHASING FROM SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED PRODUCERS (SUCH AS FARMERS OF COLOR, WOMEN FARMERS, REFUGEE FARMERS, FIRST GENERATION FARMERS, AMONG OTHERS) THROUGH FACILITATION BY THE KANSAS RURAL CENTER AND THE KANSAS STATE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE. SUBAWARD FUNDS WILL BE ALLOCATED TO SCHOOL FOOD AUTHORITIES IN TWO ALLOCATION CYCLES AND FOLLOW THE MODEL USED TO ADMINISTER THE UNITED STATE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE FOOD AND NUTRITION SERVICES SUPPLY CHAIN ASSISTANCE FUNDS TO NATIONAL SCHOOL LUNCH PROGRAM PARTICIPATING SCHOOLS WITH ALL ELIGIBLE SCHOOL FOOD  AUTHORITIES RECEIVING A BASE ALLOTMENT PLUS AND ADDITIONAL SUM BASED ON STUDENT ENROLLMENT. SCHOOL FOOD AUTHORITIES WILL BE REQUIRED TO OPT IN AND CERTIFY THAT THE FUNDS WILL ONLY BE USED FOR ALLOWABLE PURCHASES. THE KANSAS STATE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION LED LOCAL MEATS FOR SCHOOLS PROJECT WILL ADDRESS BOTH BY PROVIDING SCHOOLS IN KANSAS WITH FUNDING TO PURCHASE MINIMALLY PROCESSED AND UNPROCESSED MEATS FROM LOCAL SMALL BUSINESSES (FARMERS, RANCHERS, MEAT PROCESSORS). IN CONJUNCTION WITH THIS FUNDING, KANSAS STATE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION WILL LEVERAGE ITS EXISTING FARM TO PLATE PROGRAM INITIATIVE INCLUDING BEEF TO SCHOOL, AND ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY TO PROVIDE CONNECTION OPPORTUNITIES AND RESOURCES TO SCHOOL FOOD AUTHORITIES AND LOCAL PRODUCERS/RANCHERS/MEAT PROCESSORS, WITH SPECIAL EMPHASIS ON TARGETING SMALL BUSINESS AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED, WHEN PLANNING EVENTS AND COMMUNICATION TOOLS. QUARTERLY PERFORMANCE REPORTS WILL BE SUBMITTED TO CAPTURE THE NUMBER OF PRODUCERS, SMALL BUSINESSES AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS AND PRODUCERS, DOLLAR VALUE OF PURCHASES, AND TYPE OF FOOD PURCHASED. ANNUAL REPORTS WILL PROVIDE PERCENTAGES OF NEW MARKETING OPPORTUNITIES ESTABLISHED BY PURCHASING FROM LOCAL AND REGIONAL FARMERS AND PRODUCERS, SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS AND PRODUCERS, AND SMALL BUSINESSES. THIS KANSAS STATE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION LED PROJECT WILL SIMULTANEOUSLY INCREASE LOCAL FOOD PURCHASES BY SCHOOLS AND EXPAND OPPORTUNITIES FOR LOCAL, SMALL BUSINESSES AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED PRODUCERS. KANSAS STATE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION WILL ALLOCATE LOCAL MEAT TO SCHOOL FUNDS TO ALL NATIONAL SCHOOL LUNCH PROGRAM SPONSORS FOR A TOTAL OF 399 SCHOOL FOOD AUTHORITIES AND 507,527 STUDENTS. “TRY IT LOCAL: ARIZONA’S LOCAL FOOD FOR SCHOOLS PROGRAM” IS AN INITIATIVE THAT WILL ENCOURAGE SCHOOLS AND SUPPLY CHAIN INTERMEDIATES TO UTILIZE LOCAL FARMERS AS A SOURCE FOR SCHOOL FOOD PROCUREMENT. “TRY IT LOCAL” WILL SUPPORT THREE MODELS FOR MOVING ANY VARIETY OR SCALE OF FOODS INTO SCHOOL MEAL PROGRAMS TO ACTIVATE FARM TO SCHOOL PARTNERSHIPS ACROSS ARIZONA. THE GOALS OF “TRY IT LOCAL” ARE TO PROVIDE AN OPPORTUNITY TO STRENGTHEN ARIZONA’S LOCAL AND REGIONAL FOOD SYSTEM; SUPPORT LOCAL AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS, PRODUCERS, AND SMALL BUSINESSES BY EXPANDING ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES; AND ESTABLISH, STRENGTHEN, AND BROADEN PARTNERSHIPS WITH FARMERS, PRODUCERS AND SCHOOLS TO ENSURE DISTRIBUTION OF FRESH AND NUTRITIOUS FOODS. THE “TRY IT LOCAL ARIZONA’S LOCAL FOOD FOR SCHOOLS PROGRAM (TRY IT LOCAL)” WILL SUPPORT THREE MODELS FOR MOVING ANY VARIETY OR SCALE OF LOCAL FOODS INTO SCHOOL MEAL PROGRAMS TO ACTIVATE FARM TO SCHOOL PARTNERSHIPS ACROSS ARIZONA’S LOCAL FOOD CHAIN. “TRY IT LOCAL” IS AN INITIATIVE MARKETED TO ENCOURAGE SCHOOLS, FARMERS, AND INTERMEDIATES TO LOOK AT LOCAL FOOD FOR SCHOOL MEALS. BY EXPLORING THREE MODELS FOR PROCUREMENT, PARTNERS CAN LEVERAGE THE OPTIONS THAT WORK BEST FOR THEIR AVAILABILITY AND READINESS. SCHOOL MEAL PROGRAM OPERATORS WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO BUILD DIRECT RELATIONSHIPS WITH PRODUCERS AND LOCAL FOOD VENDORS OR SUPPLY CHAIN INTERMEDIATES, WHICH WILL DIVERSIFY THEIR ACCESS TO PRODUCTS FOR SCHOOL MEALS. “TRY IT LOCAL” IS AN OPPORTUNITY TO INCREASE AZS REACH AMONG SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED PRODUCERS BY EXPANDING THE TYPES OF LOCAL FOOD OPTIONS THAT CAN BE PURCHASED AND DISTRIBUTED AMONG UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES AND THE PATHWAYS BY WHICH SCHOOLS CAN CONNECT WITH THEIR LOCAL PRODUCERS. PROJECT BENEFICIARIES WILL INCLUDE APPROXIMATELY 250 SCHOOL DISTRICTS IN ARIZONA ALREADY ENGAGING IN FARM-TO-SCHOOL ACTIVITIES, AS WELL AS INCENTIVIZING SCHOOLS’ DISTRICTS THAT MAY HAVE BEEN PREVIOUSLY HESITANT OR DISCONNECTED FROM LOCAL PROCUREMENT ACTIVITIES. BY PROVIDING MULTIPLE OPTIONS AND ENTRY POINTS FOR BOTH SCHOOLS AND FARMERS, RECIPIENTS CAN FIND A SOLUTION OR APPROACH THAT FITS THEIR NEEDS AND READINESS TO ENGAGE IN FARM TO SCHOOL EFFORTS. ADDITIONAL PROJECT BENEFICIARIES WILL INCLUDE AT LEAST 10,000 UNDERSERVED STUDENTS IN AT LEAST 10 COUNTIES BY THE END OF PROJECT PERIOD. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO BENEFIT 65 LOCAL PRODUCERS, INCLUDING AT LEAST 39 SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED PRODUCERS, AND 100 PERCENT OF THE FUNDS WILL BE USED AT SMALL BUSINESSES ACROSS AMERICA. ARIZONA DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION HAS EXTENSIVE EXPERIENCE IMPLEMENTING FISCAL CONTROLS. THIS IS MANAGED THROUGH STRUCTURED PROCEDURES, PRACTICES AND LAYERS OF OVERSIGHT WHICH INCLUDES PARTICIPATION IN REGULAR FEDERAL AND STATE AUDITS. THE RISK AND FRAUD PREVENTION CONTROLS THROUGH THIS PROGRAM VIA SUBAWARDS AND CONTRACTS WILL BE MANAGED THROUGH ARIZONA DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION'S HEALTH AND NUTRITION SERVICES, FINANCE, BUDGET, AND ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENTS. MOST SUBAWARDS OR CONTRACTS WILL BE MANAGED THROUGH ARIZONA DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION'S GRANT MANAGEMENT SYSTEM OR ARIZONA PROCUREMENT PORTAL. BOTH SYSTEMS HAVE STRICT CONTROLS IN PLACE TO ENSURE ENTITIES APPLYING AS VENDORS OR RECIPIENTS OF STATE FUNDS ARE VETTED. QUARTERLY PERFORMANCE REPORTS WILL BE SUBMITTED TO CAPTURE THE NUMBER OF PRODUCERS, SMALL BUSINESSES AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS AND PRODUCERS, DOLLAR VALUE OF PURCHASES, AND TYPE OF FOOD PURCHASED. ANNUAL REPORTS WILL PROVIDE PERCENTAGES OF NEW MARKETING OPPORTUNITIES ESTABLISHED BY PURCHASING FROM LOCAL AND REGIONAL FARMERS AND PRODUCERS, SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS AND PRODUCERS, AND SMALL BUSINESSES. THE RECIPIENT PLANS TO SUBAWARD FUNDS TO ARIZONA SCHOOL DISTRICTS. RECIPIENTS ARE GIVEN THREE OPTIONS, ONE OF WHICH IS A SUBAWARD TO THE PARTICIPATING SCHOOL DISTRICTS.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO PURCHASE LOCAL FOOD TARGETING PURCHASES FROM SMALL BUSINESSES AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS AND RANCHERS, FOR DISTRIBUTION TO SCHOOLS. IN COLLABORATION WITH THE INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND OTHER STATEWIDE PARTNERS, THE INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH DIVISION OF NUTRITION AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY WILL LEAD THE EFFORT TO INCREASE THE AMOUNT OF LOCAL FOOD PRODUCED BY SMALL, SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS AND RANCHERS PROCURED AND SERVED IN K-12 SCHOOL CAFETERIAS IN INDIANA. THE DIVISION OF NUTRITION AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY WILL WORK WITH THE INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND PARTICIPATING DISTRIBUTORS TO DETERMINE HOW TO SELECT AND PRIORITIZE SCHOOLS TO RECEIVE LOCAL FOOD SCHOOLS-PURCHASED PRODUCTS.
